page.title: 12THE CROSSFORD CHRONICLE
page.content: {THE CROSSFORD CHRONICLE}is a newsletter which is distributed free to all the houses in CROSSFORD four times a year. Copies are also available in local shops for the use of visitors. It is financed by adverts, with any defecit being made up by the COMMUNITY COUNCIL. The Chronicle contains news of village events, e.g. the copy for April 1985 tells us that at last traffic lights have been installed at the junction of Waggon Road and Main Street, and a resident has written a poem in their honour. We also learn of the happenings of the Scouts and Guides in the village, but most important of all is the programme for the village Gala in May. (SEE PAGES 13,14,and 15). The professionally printed Chronicle is a useful source of communication within Crossford.
